DOCNAME: CASE OF WOLFGEHER AND TURULA v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE . The first and second applicants are a married couple , and the third applicant is the second applicant 's mother . They live together in the house which was the object of the litigation outlined below .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL individuals brought an action against the applicants before the GPE XX / XXI / XXIII ORG , requesting it to establish the invalidity of a contract and to order the applicants to vacate the house in which they lived .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , several hearings took place and the opinion of an expert was obtained . DATE and DATE the case was suspended pending a related procedure before the land registry .
CARDINAL . After several further hearings , on DATE ORG dismissed the action . On appeal , ORG upheld the essence of the first - instance decision on DATE .
